Summary Dynamic, execution-focused, creative product manager with nearly a decade of experience building Cloud businesses at Google as a project founder, individual contributor and team manager.  
 
Expertise: product vision and execution, product design, development and management, industry evangelism and keynote speaking, building partner ecosystems, positive team leadership and above all else, getting things done! 
 
Strong in Enterprise developer platforms, maps and location apps and services, bringing Cloud PaaS products to market, big data, launching production quality services, SaaS/PaaS pricing models, building two sided markets and the pentatonic scale. Summary Jolanta joined Google in 2003 and is now responsible for Global Billing and Payments, from product strategy and product roadmap to execution, for core Google monetization products AdWords, Google Play, AdSense, Display, and Enterprise. With her international DNA, she leads a product management team that builds localized forms of payments in the US, EMEA, LATAM, JAPAC, and BRICK countries, end-to-end, from defining user experience to integrating with external partners for payment processing, KYC, local invoicing, to internal payment tools and compliance - there is never a dull moment!  
She is a product management professional with a passion for creating great products, payments platforms, international expansion, localization, global operations, and for providing the best experience for users, wherever they might be in the world. Personally, she is a globetrotter having visited 40+ countries, aspiring photographer, and a linguist that speaks five languages. Proven track record to execute projects with direct multimillion-dollar impact, strong global e-commerce experience.  
Earlier, Jolanta was a sales manager in book publishing industry in Italy and Germany. She holds Master of Science degree in German Linguistics from University of Warsaw, Poland. Summary I'm a Senior Product Manager at Google, where I lead the location-based Display Ads team, working closely with app publishers and advertisers. I have extensive background in incepting and scaling consumer-facing products for mobile, web and TV. My mission is to introduce new and beautiful user experiences in our daily lives through disruptive technology.  
 
I joined Google in 2008, as product lead in Israel for networking and emerging market products. I then moved to headquarters in Mountain View, California. During my time at Google, I was led a variety of products including Google+ Photos, Google Offers and local commerce, Credit-card Rewards and more. In the last two years, i'm focusing on location-based Ad products. 
 
Prior to Google, I led eng and product in various small to NASDAQ-traded telecommunication companies, including Vocaltec, where we developed the first VoIP client and RADVISION, where I spearheaded a Business Unit for mobile video communication.  
 
I hold a CS degree and an MBA degree from Tel Aviv University with high honors. 
 
When I’m not designing products, I'm probably playing keyboards or biking with my daughter. Summary Dutta Satadip heads the Customer Success organization for the Americas region at Google. He is responsible for comprehensively driving operational efficiencies and customer service across a multi-billion dollar portfolio of over 150 products. He has more than 18 years of industry experience and has held various senior leadership roles spanning Pre Sales, Business Operations, Product Strategy, Product Management, Product Marketing, Engineering as well as Consulting positions. 
 
Dutta is an experienced strategic and operating executive working globally with developed and emerging countries. He has worked in startups and large corporations scaling businesses by driving customer engagement and strategic revenue oriented partnerships. He has a strong track record of developing innovative market solutions catering to a variety of enterprise customers and consumers.  
 
He is a specialist in organization transformations by being able to make tough team decisions, using analytical approaches to identify levers that execute on the strategy and increasing revenue by building customer loyalty across the organization.  
 
He frequently speaks at major conferences like TEDx on topics like Change Management, Leadership, Cloud Computing and Online Advertising. He serves on the Board of national and international non profit organizations like the National Hemophilia Foundation and Save One Life. Summary I am a Product Manager in Stockholm where I lead Google's WebRTC platform. Real Time Communication (RTC) and Product Management are my areas of expertise and interest. 
 
I moved to Sweden in 1997 to start a PhD. There, I helped I co-found Marratech AB in 1998, developing software for multi user video communication. At Marratech, I got to work across several functions: Starting a company, setting up engineering, marketing, business plans and investor relations.  
 
In 2007, after a year of consulting, our software code was sold to Google and key employees joined the search engine company.  
 
My first project was within the Google Talk team, where we launched the Gmail voice and video chat software, used by millions within Gmail, iGoogle and Orkut. 
 
I also started the project that developed into Google Hangouts video communication platform. I also started the GVC project, which resulted in Chromebox for Meetings later on.  
 
In 2009, I lead the acquisition of Global IP Solutions (GIPS). The goal of this was to give voice, video and data communication capabilities to the web, something we called WebRTC. WebRTC is a Javascript API that enables Peer to Peer audio, video and data communication between web browsers, iOS and Android.  
 
= Google is hiring in Sweden = 
Google has an important engineering presence in Stockholm:  
 
• Hangouts: 
We provide the scalable, reliable infrastructure for RTC at Google. It is used by Hangouts (audio, video and chat) and realtime messaging. These include: Chrome Sync, Google Play and others. 
 
• Chrome WebRTC 
We work on signal processing components for audio, video and bandwidth estimation. We are also responsible for the the javascript APIs in Blink, driving the W3C and IETF and integrating the signal processing bits in Chrome.  
 
• Chromebox for Meetings 
We work on integrating Hangouts inside this innovative device, enabling enterprise users to communicate at a fraction of the price of traditional equipment.

On my first week, we held the 10B promo celebrating 10B total downloads and offered discounted app purchases at 10 cent. Oh, how far we have come!! 
 
Over the years, my team's success metrics were ARPU and developer payouts. Between 5/2013-5/2014, developer payouts totaled $5 billion with continuing momentum since (see App Annie reports for unofficial estimates). The exponential growth in consumer spend outpaced Android growth every single year (in 2013 by 2.3x) of my tenure. Android is now considered to be a profitable platform that every developer must build-for (let's just say it was not always that way).  
 
Growth in consumer spend was driven by a large number of improvements to the commerce platform, including: 
 
1) Built an inline, fast, and simple purchase flow (drove significant improvement in conversion) 
2) A rich subscriptions platforms that allows for a number of recurrence types and API based CRM capabilities (used by Pandora, NYT, Evernote, etc.) 
3) Significantly increasing order processing capabilities (to a scale <5 global commerce platforms can reach). 
4) A portfolio of features to increase share of payments ready users. 
4) Simple and fast developer in-app billing APIs. 
5) Promotional platform that allows for a number of coupon types and a simple redemption experience (used by all e-copy programs, game specific launches, etc.) 
6) Google Play Gift cards (0-28 countries in 2 years!) 
7) Integrated PayPal as a form of payment (simplest PayPal integration experience there is, launched in 17 countries) 
8) Global strategy that effectively lit up markets such as Brazil (end of 2014) with a number of forms of payment. 
9) Enabled developers to earn a living selling apps in 64 countries (from <10 in 2011) 
10) Direct Carrier Billing (pay by phone) in 30 countries (from <10 in 2011) (Open) 1 recommendation Shabih Rizvi Partner at Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers Ibrahim was one of the finest Product Managers I had the pleasure of working with at Google and on the Google Play team.
